page.title: 14HULLS OLD TOWN
page.content: Hulls Old Town had become derilict and to a great extent dead. Almost nobody lived there and it seemed that nobody really cared. Then in 1973 the area was made into a Conservation area and interst started to grow. The area has 55% of Hulls listed buildings and has an area of 24.5 hectars. Not only was the area ripe for conservation it was also ready for development but these must intergrate in terms of scale, design and materials. New homes have been made from the old in many imaginative ways, for instance an old warehouse on the side of the River Hull has been converted into flats known as the Pease Development. In Prince street a row of houses built in the 1700's has been refurbished. There are also many new homes at the side of Princes dock, near the Pier and along Mytongate, giving new life.
